it.polito.dp2.WF

Interface ProcessReader


  • public interface ProcessReader
    An interface for accessing information about a process. A process is the instantiation of a workflow, i.e. a particular execution of a workflow. The execution of a process consists of the instantiation of actions that are subsequently taken over by actors and executed. A process is characterized by the start time (i.e. the instant of time when the process started) and the status (i.e. the status of each action that has been instantiated so far in the process)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Calendar getStartTime()
      Gives the starting date and time of the process.
      List<ActionStatusReader> getStatus()
      Gives the status of this process, i.e. the status of all the actions that have been instantiated so far in the process, including the ones already executed.
      WorkflowReader getWorkflow()
      Gives the workflow executed by this process.

    • Method Detail

      • getStartTime

        Calendar getStartTime()
        Gives the starting date and time of the process.
        Returns:
        the starting time and date as a Calendar

      • getWorkflow

        WorkflowReader getWorkflow()
        Gives the workflow executed by this process.
        Returns:
        an interface for accessing information about the workflow executed by this process

      • getStatus

        List<ActionStatusReader> getStatus()
        Gives the status of this process, i.e. the status of all the actions that have been instantiated so far in the process, including the ones already executed.
        The status of each action is accessible through the interface ActionStatusReader.
        Returns:
        a list of ActionStatusReader, each one giving access to the status information of a single action execution.
